name: Wings of Prey
description: Wings of Prey is based around the large-scale aerial combat and ground military operations of World War II. Players can participate in some of the war’s most famous battles piloting fighters, battle planes and bombers across a range of thrilling missions.

reviews.review_text: I am not marking this review as negative for the game itself. I enjoy playing it.  I am marking this review negative to warn the masses about the DLC. It can't be used, Yuplay are no more and although Gaijin have taken the rights, the WOP launcher still wants to connect to a YUPLAY account.  The DLC can not be used witout being looged in to a Yuplay account, which now is impossible.   Valve need to either remove the DLC from thier store post-haste, or strip WOP of the now defunct Yuplay DRM and add Steamworks so the DLC is playable. I'm not a flight sim guy but after 20-30 hours of training, I was able to figure out how to take off, fly, prevent my plane from stalling, get a plane out of a spiral, and actually destroy a few enemie planes...and then land (usually) - WHILE PLAYING ON SIMULATION MODE.  Good fun but you need to put in the time.  I recommend for someone looking for a sim but anyone looking for an arcade game, go elsewhere. This is not for you.

Brief summary of Wings of Prey: A 'Holywood' flight combat sim. Looks and sounds great, exciting to play, but lacks in mission design, AI and flight model.  +Lots of missions and planes. +Great visuals. Variety of day/night and weather conditions. Nice effects: glare, cockpit scratches, damage (bullet holes, damaged ailerons, broken gauges etc.). Cockpits look great. +Immersive 5.1 sound.  -Some of the missions in the campaign are frustratingly difficult. Some are bugged (e.g. objectives not triggering correctly). -Stalls are a bit unrealistic. -Poor documentation: Some things are never explained, like how the I-16 engine will die if you pull negative Gs, or how to use propeller pitch and radiator. -Haven't played MP, but looks like online is basically dead.  ~TrackIR is a big advantage, both for watching your six in dogfights and for spotting ground targets. ~Joystick (preferably HOTAS) is a must. Gamepad or keyboard+mouse won't cut it.

Wings of Prey is a lot more accessable than the IL-2 series and allows you to get into the game and action alot more quickly.  WoP features a ton of highly detailed aircraft that include cockpits, plus missions / gameplay spanning many combat theatres to match. There is plenty to do here in single-player, plus standard online multiplayer modes are included as well. I've gotten 100+ gameplay hours out of WoP so far.  However compared to its rivals, there are a few things lacking, notably no mission editor so you are limited beyond the missions offered and there have been some issues with multiplayer recently as support has been dropped in favour of its multiplayer-oriented sequal  War Thunder .   Despite this WoP is a really great title and frankly if your into WW2 flight games you shouldn't pass up on this (even for just the single-player), however hardcore simulation fans will fill more at home sticking with the IL-2 series.

Air combat game with attractive graphics and easy enough for average gamer not sim freak.  Should be a lot of fun, but is let down by the mission design. You're at the controls of an aircraft and looking forward to enjoying flying it, but the missions force you to dash through and complete objectives very fast, with little margin for error. Who tested this?  For example in one AI skirmish mission you're up against a ME190 but you'll have 1 pass at it before it races past and if you now need to turn you won't catch it before it leaves the map. Game over.  Another mission I repeated many many times without completing in the time space, and found many other players online stuck in the same mission.  Overall a wasted opportunity. Avoid or try it out in a sale.

Any campaign that tells you 'you failed to carry out your orders' or... 'You took too long'   then just STOPS the mission dead....   (just after you`ve shot down your TENTH messerschmitt and jussssst when you`re beginning to enjoy it....)  aint worth a carrot imho.   This IS worth buying for Flying around in the training mode (as you can choose any aircraft to fly in), -& it`s worth buying for the nice graphics .  It`s not too anal about realism and you won`t fall out of the sky each time you let go of the stick to scratch your nose either.  But forget the campaign, it`s just too snotty and annoying to be enjoyable. Nobody likes being interrupted and having the controls taken away from you just when you`re pew-pew-pewing a jerry fighter......  recommended. (Very Begrudgingly, seriously that timer sucks ♥♥♥)...  BTW j.f.i. This has crappy YUplay attached to it which keeps running even after you exit the game unless you kill the process..  I despise third party managers like yuplay, GFWL and Uplay, they add nothing but inconvienience and hassle, take up resources and generally spy on you....
